text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Agreement" means a contract or other agreement between a grantor and a distributor.

section.section: "Cancel" means to terminate an agreement prior to the natural expiration date of its term.

text.section:
"De facto cancellation" means actions taken by the grantor that:
Materially alter the competitive business and economic conditions of a distributor;
Are not applicable to similarly situated distributors of that grantor's products; and
Are intended to be discriminatory and detrimental to the distributor.
"Deficiency" means the failure of a distributor to comply substantially with the fair, reasonable, and material requirements imposed or sought to be imposed on the distributor by the grantor.

section.section:
"Distributor" does not include:
A sales representative that does not maintain an inventory of commercial goods; or
A direct seller whose work is exempt from covered employment under § 8-206(b) of the Labor and Employment Article.

text.section: "Grantor" means a person, including a manufacturer, that grants distribution and sales rights to a distributor.
